CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrack.summary: The CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrack interface of the {{domxref("Media Capture and Streams API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents the video track contained in a being generated from a {{HTMLElement("canvas")}} following a call to .

remarks.para: - to begin capturing frames from a canvas

CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrackCanvas.summary: The canvas read-only property of the interface returns the from which frames are being captured.

remarks.para:
- to create a stream to capture a
given canvas element.
-canvas

CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrackCanvas.value: An HTMLCanvasElement indicating the canvas, which is the source of the frames being captured.

CanvasCaptureMediaStreamTrackRequestFram.summary: The requestFrame() method of the interface requests that a frame be captured from the canvas and sent to the stream.

remarks.para:
Applications that need to carefully control
the timing of rendering and frame capture can use requestFrame() to
directly specify when it's time to capture a frame.

To prevent automatic capture of frames, so that frames are only captured when
requestFrame() is called, specify a value of 0 for the
method when creating
the stream.
